FuncDef:
The ppp chap user command configures a local user name.
The undo ppp chap user command deletes the configured local user name.
By default, no local user name is configured.

ParaDef.Info:
Specifies a local user name.
The value is a string of 1 to 253 characters.

ExtraInfo:
Usage Scenario
The devices on both ends of a PPP link must complete the authentication phase before entering the network-layer protocol phase during the PPP link establishment in most cases. There are two major PPP authentication modes: PAP and CHAP. CHAP authentication is available in two modes: unidirectional and bidirectional. In former mode, one end functions as the authenticator, and the other end as the authenticatee. In latter end, both ends function as the authenticator as well as the authenticatee. In practice, only the unidirectional CHAP authentication is adopted. The unidirectional CHAP authentication can be either of the following: the authenticator is configured with a user name or the authenticator is not configured with a user name.
The ppp chap user command is similar to the ppp chap password command, and is used to specify the user name with which the local Device is authenticated by the peer in CHAP mode when the peer (authenticator) is not configured with a user name. In this situation, the authenticator sends a Challenge packet to the authenticatee. Based on the password configured on its interface and the Challenge packet, the authenticatee calculates a value using encryption algorithm. Then the authenticatee sends its host name and the calculated value in a response packet to the authenticator.
Prerequisites
Interfaces are connected, and physical parameters of the interfaces are configured so that the physical layer status of the interfaces is Up.
PPP has been configured as the link layer protocol of the interface.
The authentication mode is CHAP.
Configuration Impact
If the ppp chap user command is run more than once, the latest configuration overrides the previous one. After the configuration, the peer authenticates the local Device using the configured user name.
Precautions
In VS mode, this command is supported only by the admin VS.
In CHAP authentication mode, the user names and passwords on two Devices must be the same.
After the configuration, you must run the shutdown, commit, and undo shutdown commands in the corresponding interface view for the configuration to take effect.
